newsitem.title: FINLAND: Niinisto sees strong, stable growth for Finland.
newsitem.headline: Niinisto sees strong, stable growth for Finland.

text.p: Finnish Finance Minister Sauli Niinisto said on Tuesday the outlook for the Finnish economy was now better than at any time before in the 1990s.
"At the beginning of the new year the outlook for the economy is better than ever before this decade," Niinisto wrote in a column in daily newspaper Turun Sanomat.

"We are clearly for the first time in a situation where growth expectations and confidence in a stable growth trend are in place simultaneously. A solid foundation like that has been sorely missed," he said.

"In it, I see a great opportunity to reduce unemployment," Niinisto added. The coalition government has stated that halving the unemployment rate to 8-9 percent by 1999 is its most important objective.
